titleStmt.title: E. Eastham et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9301

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency
Hon B. Magoffin:
your petitioners the undersigned would humbly represent to your that Samuel Miller who Stand convict of a fine for $16.99 for profane swearing before a justice of Lawrence County

We think he interests the consideration of the executive as the proceedings against did not warrant the inflicte of the Mr Miller is a good Citizen, and is very much esteemed by his accquaintences. & in consideration Whereof we will ever pray

Signed by E Eastham
A Barehett
J A Wellman
S. Short
Daniel Casy
P P scaggs
Jack Ride
William Troy
Levi Wellman
H. S. Booton
Thos Carter
Willis Pigg
Fred McHenry
Noah Wellman

Geo. Chapman
John Frasher
Henry Diamond Esq
Fleming McHenry
John H Livingston
Jake Rice
J W Brasher
Geo W Gallup Louisa Ky
G W Haws Sherif of Lawrence Coty
K F Prichard
County attony
G P Fansher
Samel McHenry
Samuel R. Moore
James T Lewis
James Fugate
M B Goble Clerk of the Circuit & County
C H Burgess D. S. Sheriff Do Do ^court^
Richard H Meeks
John McHenry
